title: Helping a Friend
situation: Your friend seems down during class...

dialogues.npcDialogue: Hey... I'm just not feeling great lately.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: Do you want to talk about it?
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Showing empathy helps them feel heard.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: You'll get over it.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: This dismisses their feelings.

dialogues.npcDialogue: Thanks... it's been a rough week.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: Want to go for a walk after class?
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Spending time together provides support.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: At least you're not failing like me.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: This shifts focus away from them.

dialogues.npcDialogue: I just feel really overwhelmed lately.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: I'm here for you. Do you want to share what's been hardest?
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Creates a safe space for expression.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: That’s life. We all go through stuff.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Minimizes their individual struggle.

dialogues.npcDialogue: Sometimes it feels like no one notices how I feel.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: I’m sorry you feel that way. I’m glad you told me.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Affirms their emotions and courage to speak.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: That’s not true, people care—you’re overthinking.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Invalidates their perspective.

dialogues.npcDialogue: It helps talking to you. You're easy to talk to.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: Thank you. I'm always here if you need to talk.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Reinforces support and availability.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: Cool. Anyway, did you do the homework?
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Suddenly shifting topics can seem insensitive.

dialogues.npcDialogue: I’ve been skipping lunch because I don’t feel hungry.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: Would you like me to join you for lunch tomorrow?
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Encourages healthy behavior with company.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: Skipping a few meals isn't a big deal.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Can normalize unhealthy coping mechanisms.

dialogues.npcDialogue: Some nights I barely sleep, I keep overthinking things.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: Have you tried journaling or talking to a counselor?
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Gently introduces helpful coping strategies.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: Just tire yourself out during the day.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Not a meaningful solution to sleep issues.

dialogues.npcDialogue: Do you think I should talk to someone professionally?

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: Absolutely, it could really help you feel better.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Encourages reaching out for professional help.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: You’re not that bad. Therapy is for serious problems.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Stigmatizes mental health support.

title: Helping a Depressed Friend
situation: Your friend has been acting distant and withdrawn lately. You notice they haven’t been themselves for a while and seem emotionally exhausted.

dialogues.npcDialogue: I just don’t feel like talking to anyone these days...

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: I understand. I'm here if you need someone.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Acknowledging their need for space while offering support shows empathy.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: You’re just overthinking things.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: This dismisses their emotional struggle.

dialogues.npcDialogue: Sometimes it feels like nothing matters anymore.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: That sounds really hard. Want to talk about what's been going on?
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Inviting them to share fosters trust and connection.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: Try thinking positive, it’ll go away.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Toxic positivity can invalidate real emotions.

dialogues.npcDialogue: Even when I’m around people, I still feel alone.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: You're not alone. I'm with you and care about you.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Assuring presence can be a great comfort.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: Maybe you're being too sensitive.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: This may make them feel judged or misunderstood.

dialogues.npcDialogue: Lately I’ve just been so tired of everything.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: That sounds exhausting. Have you thought about talking to a professional?
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Gently suggesting help shows concern.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: Maybe you just need more sleep.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Oversimplifying the issue misses the emotional depth.

dialogues.npcDialogue: I’ve been skipping meals and barely sleep.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: That worries me. Would it help if I checked in regularly?
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Consistent support can make someone feel valued.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: You'll be fine. Just eat and sleep properly.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Minimizes the seriousness of mental health decline.

dialogues.npcDialogue: Sometimes I feel like a burden to everyone.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: You’re not a burden. Your feelings matter, and I’m here.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Directly affirming worth helps counter self-blame.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: Everyone has problems. Deal with it.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Lacks compassion and isolates the person further.

dialogues.npcDialogue: I don't even know why I'm still trying...

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: I'm really glad you're still trying. That shows strength.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Recognizing their effort validates their struggle.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: You’re being dramatic.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Invalidates genuine emotional pain.

dialogues.npcDialogue: Thanks for listening... I wasn’t sure anyone cared.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: Of course I care. You matter to me.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Affirmation and reassurance build trust and hope.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: Well, I guess it’s good you said something.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Lacks warmth and may feel obligatory.

title: Understanding a Friend with ADHD
situation: Your friend has recently shared that they have ADHD. You've noticed they struggle with focus, forget things often, and sometimes get overly energetic or impulsive. You want to support them better.

dialogues.npcDialogue: I’m really trying to focus, but my mind keeps jumping around...

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: That sounds frustrating. Is there a way I can help you stay on track?
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Offering help with empathy shows understanding of their challenge.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: Just try harder to concentrate.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Misunderstands the involuntary nature of ADHD symptoms.

dialogues.npcDialogue: I keep forgetting to bring my homework again...

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: It happens. Maybe we can set a reminder together?
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Shows support without blame and encourages problem-solving.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: You’re just being careless.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Assumes laziness instead of recognizing executive function issues.

dialogues.npcDialogue: Sometimes I blurt things out and regret it right after.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: I know you don’t mean to. It’s okay, I’m here for you.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Recognizing impulsivity as part of ADHD builds trust.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: You should think before you speak.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Ignores how impulse control works in ADHD.

dialogues.npcDialogue: People always think I’m lazy or not trying...

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: I know that’s not true. I see how hard you’re trying.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Validation is powerful for people constantly misunderstood.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: Maybe try being more organized.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Minimizes the internal effort already being made.

dialogues.npcDialogue: I get bored really easily, even in things I care about.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: That’s valid. Want to take breaks or change it up together?
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Being flexible helps someone with ADHD stay engaged.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: That’s just an excuse to not finish stuff.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Judges the behavior instead of understanding the condition.

dialogues.npcDialogue: Group work stresses me out. I feel like I’m slowing everyone down.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: We all work differently. Let’s find a way that works for you too.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Supports inclusion and values their input.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: Then maybe you shouldn’t do group work.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Excludes and discourages participation.

dialogues.npcDialogue: I zone out a lot during class... it just happens.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: That’s okay. Want me to share notes or help you catch up?
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Supportive actions help reduce anxiety around symptoms.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: Then pay attention. It’s not that hard.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Dismissive of how ADHD affects attention span.

dialogues.npcDialogue: Thanks for not judging me. It’s hard enough already.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: Of course. I’m learning too and want to be a better friend.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Demonstrates humility and compassion.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: Well, I guess you’re trying your best.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Sounds condescending or detached, even if well-intentioned.

title: Being There for a Friend with PTSD
situation: Your friend has confided that they’re dealing with PTSD after a traumatic experience. They’ve been withdrawn, easily startled, and avoid certain situations. You want to respond with empathy and support.

dialogues.npcDialogue: Sometimes I get flashbacks out of nowhere. It's overwhelming.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: That must be terrifying. I’m here if you need to talk.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Acknowledges the severity and offers a safe space.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: Just try to distract yourself.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Minimizes their emotional experience.

dialogues.npcDialogue: Loud noises make me panic... I can't help it.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: Would you like to move somewhere quieter?
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Helps reduce triggers with empathy.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: You need to toughen up.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Dismisses their trauma response.

dialogues.npcDialogue: I avoid certain places because they remind me of what happened.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: That's completely valid. We can hang out elsewhere.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Respecting boundaries helps them feel safe.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: You’ll never heal if you keep avoiding things.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Forces progress and ignores their pacing.

dialogues.npcDialogue: People don’t really get what I’m going through.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: I may not fully get it, but I want to understand.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Shows willingness to learn and be supportive.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: You’re probably overthinking it.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Invalidates their emotional state.

dialogues.npcDialogue: I feel like I’m broken sometimes.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: You’re not broken. You’re strong for surviving.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Reframes their struggle with strength.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: Everyone goes through stuff, just deal with it.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Lacks compassion and context for trauma.

dialogues.npcDialogue: I can’t sleep some nights because of nightmares.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: That sounds awful. I’m here if you need company or distraction.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Provides comfort and solidarity.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: Just take a pill and sleep.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Over-simplifies a complex condition.

dialogues.npcDialogue: I’m always on edge. It’s exhausting.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: Take your time. I won’t rush or pressure you.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Patience shows deep emotional support.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: Why are you so sensitive?
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Criticizes behavior caused by PTSD.

dialogues.npcDialogue: Thanks for listening... most people avoid me after I open up.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: I care about you and I’m not going anywhere.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Reinforces trust and safety in the relationship.

dialogueOptions.dialogueOption: Well, it's kind of heavy stuff to deal with.
dialogueOptions.careLoopExplanation: Expresses discomfort and could push them away.
